definition: lit. to hold a bowl of water level (idiom)/fig. to be impartial
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
bowl/cup/CL:隻|只[zhi1],個|个[ge4]
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
end/extremity/item/port/to hold sth level with both hands/to carry/regular
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
surname Ping

sentences.english: So in Beijing's eyes, Washington has now taken sides.
sentences.chinese: 因此，在北京看來，華盛頓並不打算一碗水端平。

sentences.english: The old woman always made a difference between her two grandsons.
sentences.chinese: 老太太對待她的兩個孫兒從不一碗水端平。

definition: lit. both the palm and the back of the hand are made of flesh (idiom)/fig. to both be of equal importance/to value both equally
pinyin: shou3 xin1 shou3 bei4 dou1 shi4 rou4

definition: to favour one and discriminate against the other
to bare one shoulder/(fig.) to side with/to discriminate in favor of
to treat everyone equally favorably (idiom); not to discriminate between people
partial/biased/prejudiced/eccentric
bias/partiality/to be partial
to practice favoritism
(of a woman) to be fiercely protective of one's children
it's nothing personal (idiom)
to try to smooth things over/to paper over the issues/to gloss things over
to shield (a miscreant) from punishment, criticism etc/to take sb's side
to put oneself in sb else's shoes (idiom)
to discuss sth on its own merits/to judge the matter as it stands
polite and amiable
to take the big picture into consideration (idiom)/to work for the benefits of all
to defend sb (a relative, friend or oneself) despite knowing that that person is in the wrong
